Description: Rim sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; lotus flower and palmette in added red and white above two white bands; exterior: at rim, broken maeander pattern between narrow brown bands; below, painted decoration consisting of horse riding scene to right (part of head with red on mane, neck and shoulder in black of bridled horse and black tail of another horse to right).
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the Naukratis Painter. The painter and the group are named after a chalice found at Naukratis and the slip on all vessels from this group is a light beige to almost creamy white. Rim patterns are very simple and there is no filling ornament. The depiction of figures, however, is very elaborate. Clothing is rendered highly decorated and naked skin is expertly portrayed. For parallels regarding the horse, see British School at Athens Sherd 12.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 276, no. 739, pl. III, pl. 97)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0808) (phase 2)
